intro: Boerhavia commersonii, commonly known as redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a low-growing annual herb with small, fleshy leaves and distinctive red or purple stems. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Boerhavia commersonii is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
